attributes.action: Ban the use of sat navs designed for cars by lorries
attributes.background: Lorries using sat navs designed for cars have caused numerous accidents by driving down roads not intended for use by lorries

attributes.action: Make DVSA to allow cameras during the driving exams.
attributes.background:
There are too many wrongful decisions and incompetent driving examiners out there, but DVSA does not allow any recording, inside or outside of the vehicle during examinations.
Lets allow filming of exams, to put pressure on examiners to judge exams fairly, and to keep record for despute if needed.

attributes.action: The Government should set up an independent body to monitor MPs Social Media
attributes.background: Social media usage by MPs is on the increase and given their influence over potential voters it is important that the posts that MPs write, share and endorse are clear and honest and not misleading or false in anyway. The Government  should set up an independent body to monitor these accounts.
attributes.additional_details: Some voters accept as genuine, without question, posts on social media that are either written, endorsed or shared by MPs. The government should set up an independent body to monitor and police MPs Social Media accounts. Were it can be proven an MP has intentionally lied or spread false information on Social Media, this body should have regulatory powers to impose sanctions and or fines on the MPs responsible. It is important that MPs are seen to be as transparent as possible.

attributes.action: Referendum for England & Wales to leave the UK if we don't leave the EU & Laws
attributes.background: It was clear in the referendum that the free movement of Labour was one of the main reasons people voted to leave the EU. We do not want to be bound by the EU or any of its laws and this includes the single market and especially free movement of people. IF Scotland can push for this then so can I/we
attributes.additional_details: Refer to the refruredum leave campaign about controlling immigration, via using a different system and taking back control of our laws.

attributes.action: Stop Cuts To Mental Health
attributes.background: Mental Health is a illness which can not be taken away it will always be part of the person it effects, it's not like breaking a leg and it will health this is something that will never heal.  Theresa May talks about a country that works for everyone why not mentally ill people
attributes.additional_details: If cuts are made to Mental Health then place where people can go to talk about this may have to close then there would be nothing left for them. Just the opportunity to talk to someone it can make a big difference, but if this was taken away who would they talk to some people have no family and are all alone. People take their own lives or self harm because there is no help for them. How would you feel if someone you cared about did this!?

attributes.action:
1.Importance of voters age of 50 years and above.
2.Allow 16 years old to vote.
attributes.background: I used to study in UK  .As a foreigner it felt so good that something which British citizens (locals) were voting and i as a foreigner was also voting.That showed me the importance,responsibility and equity in that very moment about voting.
attributes.additional_details:
1.Considering double the votes for elections only for those voters above the age of 50 years.As elders know the best to choose and by doing so it will encourage the young generation to vote and also to choose wisely and the best for the nation.
2.Allow 16 years old to vote.There should be proper knowledge provided to the students in schools & colleges about what the votes are and what are the benefits to vote for themselves and for the nation.

attributes.action: Pair schools here with school in developing world to send over technology.
attributes.background: In order to help implement resources to help out children in the developing world we think that by donating technology we can make a difference to their lives. For example, a computer could help give children an insight in different opportunities available

attributes.action: The Prime Minister, to chair a COBRA meeting to resolve the NHS crisis
attributes.background:
Unnecessary deaths are occurring because of the crisis engulfing the NHS.

The Prime Minister needs to declare the current crisis an emergency and look at ways of saving lives.

A COBRA meeting should be called and the Prime Minister needs to act now to respond to this current situation.

attributes.action: Carers leave for those in full time employment to care for an immediate relative
attributes.background: Having seen the NHS crisis it is clear that most of the problem is "bed blocking" patients who's treatment is complete but cannot go home as there is no home care in place. Instead of waiting for Social care to be sorted. It would be preferable for a relative to be allowed paid leave.
attributes.additional_details: This could become a right in the same way as maternity leave. Used for short term care to relieve strains on social care as has recently been disclosed on News media.

attributes.action: Reverse the past 5 years of cuts to Social Care Budgets
attributes.background: The NHS is grinding to a halt often due to the lack of social care for patients awaiting discharge from hospital, and from the lack of community care obliging the elderly to attend A&E when they would be better helped at home.  The UK's Social care budget has been cut by 31% over the past 5 years.
attributes.additional_details: Financial Statistics from the UK Directors of Adult Social Services budget survey 2015

attributes.action: Have an honest open debate about the NHS, social care, future funding & needs.
attributes.background: All political parties disguise the truth facing the people of Britain; the NHS and social care is woefully underfunded and perhaps badly or structurally managed. In any event it does not meet our current or future needs and this is not just a problem for now it is a problem for many years to come.
attributes.additional_details:
There are many links where supporting "evidence" can be found and doubtless the government will point to contrary "evidence." But that misses the spirit of this petition - forget the politics let the people decide decide what we need and then how best to fund it. Nothing should be ruled out or in.

https://www.kingsfund.org.uk/projects/nhs-in-a-nutshell/health-care-spending-compared

https://fullfact.org/health/uk-health-spending-compared-france-and-germany/

attributes.action: Stop funding Free Childcare for parents who do not work
attributes.background: The Government currently fund free childcare places for children over 2 years old, if the parents fall within a set 'eligibility criteria'. This includes Job Seekers Allowance. Surely parents who are unemployed can look after their own children. Maybe Job Centre can issue vouchers for interviews etc

attributes.action: Make driving lessons a part of the education system for 16-18 year olds
attributes.background: making driving a part of the education system could potentially lower the amount of car accidents on the roads involving young people. many people have an accident in their first year of driving, teaching young people about the dangers of driving at a younger age could prevent this.

attributes.action: Make the Government cut V.A.T on "ethical" products.
attributes.background: We the undersigned are demanding that the government promise that once we have left the EU and have control over a V.A.T, products which can be considered "ethical" shall have a V.A.T cut in order to make them more affordable for people and families in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details:
They could be products which:

- in their production cause no harm to the environments they are produced in, 
- no harm is caused to any animals which are part of the products production, 
- all parties who help create the product are paid a fair and decent amount in return for their work.

Examples of products like these would be free-range eggs or FairTrade products.
With this, the general public will be more inclined to buy these, as they will be more affordable.

attributes.action:
Make July 1st Diana Princess of Wales Day
.....a National Bank Holiday....
attributes.background: 20 years ago we lost this amazing woman and what better tribute to her than making her birthday, July 1st, a national bank holiday to celebrate her life and the joy she brought to millions in this country and around the world......

attributes.action: Enforce pet ownership licence for each animal owned and microchipping
attributes.background: There are too many animals being dumped, abandoned and stolen in the UK.  It is deeply upsetting to see horses dumped because they have been neglected, family dogs stolen for baiting in dog fights and the resulting injured dogs.  This can be controlled by enforcing animal owners to obtain a licence.
attributes.additional_details:
There is endless evidence from all the animal rescue charities. RSPCA and World Horse Welfare to name a couple.  The number of unwanted animals is increasing each year. Some control must be taken
I suggest a large fines for non licences or bin chipped animals and pets.  Any unlicensed or Unchipped should be removed into care for resale or rehoming. The fines will cover the cost of sending out enforcing officers and administrative costs.

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing assessments for PIP and make fit for Mental Health sufferers.
attributes.background: The current assessment trivialises common issues like depression and anxiety and does not take these into consideration when deciding these claims. The form and the assessor only consider physical ailments and not how mental ability often prevent physical ability and is tantamount to discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: ATOS Healthcare also often misrepresent an individuals needs and conversations they have had during PIP assessments and this has been well documented in the press and many websites previously. Here are a couple of examples: http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/new-claims-of-atos-assessment-lies-are-tip-of-a-massive-iceberg/ and http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/atos-nurse-lied-about-pip-claimant-attending-assessment-alone/

attributes.action: Make Laser Eye Surgery available as a free NHS service for all eye conditions.
attributes.background: For those people who where glasses and those who do not, as a 20 year old, I struggle with the prospect of knowing that I will have to see the greatest years and future years of my life behind glass, as I am unable to afford the treatment myself.
attributes.additional_details:
Laser eye surgery is available on the NHS for eye conditions that, without treatment, can lead to loss of vision. However, it’s not available for conditions that can be treated successfully in other ways, such as refractive (focusing) errors. 

The reasons for this are that the effect is life changing for the person receiving the treatment. The current means of correcting refractive errors, glasses, are not for everyone.

attributes.action: Allow NHS staff of 15+ years to retire early. At the age of 55.
attributes.background: Allow NHS staff who have worked for the service for 15+ years to retire early with a full pension at the age of 55. This is for their dedication to to the service and time that they have missed with family members over the years whilst caring for others family members.

attributes.action: Stop risking our lives and health. Set up a royal commission to reform the NHS.
attributes.background: I am a retired medical doctor and have seen standards in health care deteriorate over several decades. My own experience and that of family and friends have reinforced that view. It is time to do something positive.
attributes.additional_details: Letter to The Sunday Times November 20, 2016 by over 60 consultants calling for a royal commission to cure the NHS. Leading article in the same issue by Sarah-Kate Templeton: 'We must think the unpalatable to stop death of NHS say doctors'. Owen Paterson's report in October 2016 comparing the UK's NHS with other systems in the West. It found that 46,000 people died unnecessarily each year because of failings in our health service.

attributes.action: Introduce 2 part practical driving test, with the inclusion of a motorway test.
attributes.background:
Motorists lack of knowledge of the Highway Code is creating a culture of dangerous driving, which is likely to be the cause of many accidents.

I would like to see the current driving test revised to introduce a new 
2nd part that tests a motorists practical competence of motorway driving.
attributes.additional_details:
A learner driver is prohibited from using a motorway, and their first use of a motorway will only be after they have passed their driving test. Drivers need to be tested on their practical competence and application of the rules before being allowed on motorways alone. 

On a daily basis I witness motorist's breaching rules 264, 267 & 268 of the Highway Code which cover lane discipline and overtaking. DoT report of road traffic accidents shows an increase of people killed or seriously injured.

attributes.action: Introduce "tax free allowance" after working 37.5 hours or more per week
attributes.background: Every year, thousands of hard working people work 50/60 hour weeks to supplement their pay and are taxed to high heaven. If someone works hard, should they have their reward taken from them? People should not be taxed for working extra.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to do under the speed limit (when there's no traffic)
attributes.background: It's illegal to do over the speed limit because you could crash and/or kill someone BUT people doing under the speed limit can be just as bad.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been lots of times when people have been doing the speed limit and had to brake hard because a learner or unconfident driver is doing half or under half the speed limit.

AND times when people do the national speed limit on country roads and they come around a corner to find someone doing 20mph. It's not safe.

It also causes traffic and delays on the roads

attributes.action: Ban disturbing photo's on new tobacco packaging
attributes.background:
Ban disturbing photos on new tobacco packaging

New tobacco packaging law became introduced to the UK in May 2016 which concluded that blank packaging would be made for all tobacco products. New photographic images are also in place with new packaging which are incredibly disturbing to the public.
attributes.additional_details:
One packaging strikes myself which is incredibly appalling to be advertised is the packaging 'Smoking kills your unborn child' with a shocking image of a baby coffin with grieving parents looking over the cot. This image is absurd to anyone who may be going through miscarriage/loss child who DO NOT even smoke. 

Ban these shocking images, blank packaging is reasonable without going over the top.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for individuals or businesses to own more than 3 houses.
attributes.background: I can understand having second, even third homes but the property market is out of control and will continue to be so given the economic environment we live in. The damage here is to social mobility, community, growing inequality and to people who are low-medium skilled.
attributes.additional_details:
I see no appropriate or logical reason to own multiple (I.e more than 3). There is no justifiable reason that I can see. 

Business will get around this so there will need to be incredibly tight restrictions on commercial properties and a rigorous approach to those looking to bypass the law.

attributes.action: we need to follow the example of other countries and burn landfill for energy
attributes.background: Landfill is taking over a lot of land in the UK. We should follow by example and burn our rubbish for recycled energy

attributes.action: Censor the broadcast of sexually explicit music to protect young children
attributes.background: I am petitioning the British Government to consider censoring the broadcast of sexually explicit music during the day to protect young listeners / viewers.
attributes.additional_details:
I've heard young children singing along to lyrics which are highly sexually suggestive. 

Over the last decade music has become increasingly sexualised and continues to evade existing censorship legislation / regulation.

attributes.action: Make the police non emergency number 101 a freephone number.
attributes.background: Currently the cost of calling 101 is 15p per call, yet the similar non emergency number of the NHS 111 is free, this needs to be resolved as most people in the UK use mobile phones and mostly on contracts where their minutes wouldn't cover the 15p charge to report a crime.

attributes.action: Ban schools from giving out detention!
attributes.background:
Children are feeling more depressed and upset after having detention. What gives schools the right to keep our children behind after school. It teaches them absolutely nothing!.
This is going against our human rights. Holding us in a place of solitude and opression!
attributes.additional_details:
My child has never been given a detention before and she is very shy and scared of most things. she gets upset over little things. Last night she was given detention and came home really upset. she is now refusing to go school.
My friends son also was given a detention for 'coughing too many time' as the teacher thought he was messing around. however he just had a cold. he now never speaks to that teacher ever and hates her

attributes.action: Oblige all licensed premises to accept Pass Cards as ID and proof of age
attributes.background: Some premises allow Pass Cards to be used as ID, but some pubs and clubs don't allow them and claim they are fake. It is a legit form of identification. Every licensed premise that requires some form of ID to enter should allow Pass Cards just as it allows passports and driving licenses.
attributes.additional_details:
For example I went to a pub with a few friends for a birthday, the bouncer asked where I got it from. I said it’s from the challenge 25 website which has multiple different pass cards and it is a legitimate form of ID. He said nope that is fake, I can get that from ebay or somewhere else online. 

For more information see: http://www.pass-scheme.org.uk/

attributes.action: Charge bus pass users 50p per single trip equating to £1 per return journey.
attributes.background: My husband and I are both pensioners but are not, by any means, "wealthy". Like most pensioners we appreciate a free bus pass but feel that a minimal charge each time we travel is not going to cause hardship. The money generated by this small charge could go towards desperate road repairs locally.

attributes.action: Make teaching 'Children's Rights' compulsory in all schools.
attributes.background: There are a list of more than 40 rights, which each child has. Most children don't even know these rights exist. Teaching children's rights in schools will inform all children of the rights they have.

attributes.action: Make all GP's open for half a day every Saturday or Sunday
attributes.background: There are so many people that can't get time off work for doctor's appointments due to their regular working weeks, example, 9-5 Monday to Friday. Opening the GP's for a couple of hours at the weekend will allow for those that struggle to arrange doctor's appointments without having to book holidays
attributes.additional_details: I work as a healthcare assistant, Monday to Friday, if i didn't turn up to work their would be vulnerable adults left at risk, but I still need to look after my own health, if I get ill so do my clients. Why should I have to book holiday to see the doctor.

attributes.action: Please, Contract BAE to develop a Harrier III.
attributes.background: The Harrier was the ONLY V/STOL jet IN THE WORLD. Instead of capitalising on a technological monopoly, the British Government sold the country out and our industry out to the Americans. Now we buy their exorbitant £100+ Million a piece F-35 STOVL jet with a program cost of $1.5 Trillion. Shameful.
attributes.additional_details: The cost to develop a Harrier III from the Harrier II, I am absolutely certain, would have been a fraction of the disastrous, bug ridden JSF program. The Unit cost too, I am certain, would have been been fractional. It's a matter of national pride too. What do we have left that we can be proud of? Concorde? Harrier? The world wanted these things. But no. Scrap it and buy American or EU... 'REDUCE F-35 ORDER AND REINVEST THE REMAINING *Billions* INTO A SYMBOL OF NATIONAL PRIDE: The Harrier III'.

attributes.action: Start to pay off the UK's Debt.
attributes.background: We are all told as young people not to spend money which you don't have, so why should the UK government do it. It's not only getting bigger, but is effecting our NHS which should be run like the US government, to fix this tax the rich more, the poor shouldn't have to pay for the rich and vice versa

attributes.action: Cease/cut aid to Sierra Leone until the government amend protest laws.
attributes.background: Cease/cut aid to Sierra Leone until the government amend protest laws....
attributes.additional_details:
The Government of Sierra Leone cracks down heavily on peaceful protests. It has become illegal to protest the injustices in the country without a police clearance. This is contrary to democracy and free speech. We, the people, hardly ever get the police clearance to voice our concerns. When we do, our voices are highly censored. We face hot water canons, live ammunition and police batons if we dare to protest without a police clearance. 
The UK Government gives a significant amount of aid to the Sierra Leonean government on the basis of it practicing democratic principles. Denying us the right to protest is undemocratic in every aspect. Cutting aid funds until they revisit those provisions that suppress free speech will force them into a civil dialogue with the people they ought to serve.

attributes.action: Limit how much a Estate Agent can charge for a Credit Check for new tenants
attributes.background: Credit searches for new tenants costs the Estate Agent around £7 a search. Most new tenants have to pay the Estate Agent between £120 and £250 for this. It's hard enough trying to fund a house move without the EA taking a huge chunk. This fee needs capping at no more that £50pp

attributes.action: Change the rules give children detained by police at school access to legal aid
attributes.background: Call for change to access legal aid so children can get justice against the actions of the police working in co-ordination with local authorities to secretly wrongfully detain innocent children at school, revoking their rights & right to their parents and misusing their data without any wrongdoing.
attributes.additional_details: In the light of police action to pre-plan with local authorities to detain an innocent 12 old child at school, the consequences of the event and negative impact to the child’s future education and misuse of data which may affect the child’s future, the system needs to change. Currently there is no protection for innocent children, due to the unfair system the public authorities’ access public money to engage legal experts to defend their actions. Children’s rights matter, legal aid is required.

attributes.action: Make Business Studies, Life Skills and Politics mandatory at Secondary School.
attributes.background: In school there is no direct focus on skills that children need to truly succeed in life. Business Studies is taken an optional subject when really we should be teaching our children how to be entrepreneurial, this would help children gain essential critical thinking skills to help them grow.
attributes.additional_details: There is so much opportunity that is potentially being wasted by not equipping children with the skills and knowledge to get on in life. Children should have a knowledge of politics, business, how to get a mortgage. Children should know who the Prime Minister of this country is and how laws are made. If we want our country to be set up for success we should invest in our children as they will invest in the country themselves.

attributes.action: Include Aesthetic Impairment or "Ugliness" in The Equality Act 2010.
attributes.background: We call for “Aesthetic Impairment” to be added to The Equality Act (2010) by the UK government and for suffers to be awarded the same protection from discrimination as the other included groups.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people whom are aesthetically Impaired or “ugly” face discrimination and disadvantage on a daily basis. Many unattractive people can be left feeling ostracised and questioning their self-worth and it can also lead to the development of mental health issues. 

Whatever the nature or route cause of someone’s appearance, not everybody can conform with the image of what our society deems to be “attractive” and to judge someone based upon this is fundamentally wrong.

attributes.action: Stop stereotyping teenagers by making national citizen service compulsory
attributes.background: We are a group of teenagers who feel like we are stereotyped frequently, such as being followed in shops, being stopped and searched in groups, seen as criminals and thugs, this makes us feel on edge and ashamed to be called a teenager. We feel our aim will make society a better place, aged 16-18.
attributes.additional_details: Our research found that often terms used to describe teenagers were "hoodies, louts, heartless, evil, frightening, scum, monsters, inhumane and threatening."

attributes.action: Total life Ban if caught using hand held mobile phone
attributes.background: If caught using a hand held mobile phone for talking or texting you should be given a total life time ban from driving.

attributes.action: Give long term partners the same inheritance rights as a spouse
attributes.background: I lost my partner of 25 years, we owned a home and a business together. When he died without leaving a will I had to buy his share of our business, home and buy all of his belongings at the full market value from his only son. I was not financially dependent on him and therefore had no entitlement.

attributes.action: Repeal  the Health and Social Care Bill.
attributes.background: This bill has signed the death knell for the NHS as we knew it. It has allowed private companies to cherry pick via tender the most lucrative parts of the system. This can not be allowed to continue. The NHS should be there for all.

attributes.action: The prohibition of  vehicle drivers smoking whilst driving
attributes.background: Drivers concentration must be  affected by smoking whilst driving.Observation  over many years show drivers smoking are often  using one hand to control the vehicle- lighting up and extinguishing the cigarette  must further affects drivers concentration

attributes.action: Government should not allow pilots to work on Christmas day
attributes.background:
This is a petition to bring to attention pilots who fly thousands of miles away from their families on the most precious day of the year for many people! 

Help me petition government to put a ban to flying on Christmas day!
attributes.additional_details:
I am surrounded by pilots, many of whom complain about working in Christmas day. The banks shut, so why shouldn't pilots have a "pilot day"? 

I call on government to help pilots and their families spend their day together. 

If pilots are being forced to fly on Christmas day, their families should be rewarded with free flights and accommodation to enable the families to be together. 

Please call on government to make this a possibility!

attributes.action: Allow Ambulances with a patient on board the right to use bus lanes any time.
attributes.background: As Ambulance crew it is very frustrating to have to sit in a endless queue of traffic with a patient on board who although may not be in a life threatening condition may be distressed or in pain while a empty bus lane is available. If empty Taxis and solo mopeds can use them then why not a Ambulance

attributes.action: I would like the Government to reinstate Child Support Agency!
attributes.background: We need a government run Child Support Agency as the so called Child Maintenance Service is not meeting the correct criteria. Causing a high level of financial suffering for the parent who is raising the child/children. The absent parent is not being forced to supply correct financial  information.

attributes.action: Small business should not pay employer's NI for employees of state pension age
attributes.background: Employees or Self-Employed of state pension age do not pay NI contributions so why should Employers? I spoke to David Cameron about this and he was intending to look into it but this did not happen due to the EU referendum result

attributes.action: Negotiate a bespoke reciprocal visa agreement between the UK and the EU
attributes.background: Now the UK voted to leave the EU we will lose the freedom of movement right. This will cease once we leave and will mean we have to apply for a visa to go to the EU on holiday as we are third country nationals. The EU has plans to introduce a £50 holiday visa for citizens of third countries.
attributes.additional_details: This £50 charge is quite expensive for a holiday visa and will deter people going abroad. The only option could be a reciprocal visa agreement between the UK and the EU/EEA. This could mean that UK citizens can travel to the EU, for 180 days, for free. This however, is only possible if we allow all EU nationals coming to the UK the same agreements. We could also include reciprocal emergency healthcare in this visa agreement. This will make it easier for full single market access.
